intro: Astragalus ervoides var. ervoides, commonly known as the ervoides milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus ervoides var. ervoides is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
